tool.name: OSMGPUpload

param.name: in_osmURL
param.dialogReference: The server end-point URL to which the data will be uploaded. The main OSM server is located at http://www.openstreetmap.org.
param.pythonReference: The server end-point URL to which the data will be uploaded. The main OSM server is located at http://www.openstreetmap.org.

param.name: in_editchanges
param.dialogReference: The geodatabase table holding the edit changes. The table has a name like name_osm_revision.
param.pythonReference: The geodatabase table holding the edit changes. The table has a name like name_osm_revision.

param.name: in_uploadcomment
param.dialogReference: Provide a brief statement describing the local edits.
param.pythonReference: Provide a brief statement describing the local edits.

param.name: in_uploadformat
param.dialogReference: Indicates if all the changes should be uploaded as one change request to the OSM server. Recommended practice is to attempt to upload as a bundle and if that fails, attempt again with the option unchecked. Leaving the option unchecked allows for investigating the failure with the Conflict Editor.
param.pythonReference: Indicates if all the changes should be uploaded as one change request to the OSM server. Recommended practice is to attempt to upload as a bundle and if that fails, attempt again with the option unchecked. Leaving the option unchecked allows for investigating the failure with the Conflict Editor.

param.name: in_authentication_login
param.dialogReference: Provide the user name and password of the OSM editing account.
param.pythonReference: Provide the user name and password of the OSM editing account.

tool.summary: This tool allows the user to upload local edits back to the OSM (OpenStreetMap) server.
tool.usage:
• Up until the user uploads the edits to the OSM (OpenStreetMap) server, all changes are local.

  • Changes are tracked locally and they are stored in a geodatabase table _osm_revision.

  • In order to upload data to the OSM server the user needs a valid edit account. Signing up for an account can be done at the OpenStreetMap sign up page.

  • Before uploading the data please take another look at the copyright of the data of your upload or at the copyright of the data from which the edits are derived. If the copyrights are questioned by the community, the uploaded data will be removed.

scriptExample.title: Upload OSM Data Sample (Python)
scriptExample.para: This Python window sample demonstrates how to upload local edits back to the OpenStreetMap (OSM) server.
scriptExample.code:
# import the system modules import arcpy, base64 from arcpy import env
# load the OpenStreetMap specific toolbox arcpy.ImportToolbox(r'd:\projects\OSMEditor\WheelChairMap\OpenStreetMap Toolbox.tbx')
env.workspace = r'd:\projects\OSMEditor\WheelChairMap\defaultstorage.gdb'
# encode your OSM user name and password userName = 'ThatsMe' passWord = 'secret' encodedLogin = base64.b64encode(userName + ':' + passWord)
# upload the local edits to the OSM server arcpy.OSMGPUpload_osmtools(r'http://www.openstreetmap.org', 'stuttgart_osm_revision', 'added wheel chair accessiblity information around the marketplace', encodedLogin)

dataIdInfo.idAbs: This tool allows the user to upload local edits back to the OSM (OpenStreetMap) server.
This tool allows the user to upload local edits back to the OSM (OpenStreetMap) server.
